title: Are users avoiding `quarkus update` it's because they don't know what it does or doesn't do?

labels.name: area/devtools
labels.description: Issues/PR related to maven, gradle, platform and cli tooling/plugins

body:
### Describe the bug

In a couple of email threads, users updating to Quarkus 3 hint that they've opted to use the Migration guide instead of the `upgrade command` because they don't have enough information about what the command does. I've expressed this as the following user story:

### User story
. As a developer deciding whether to use the update command, knowing which tasks the update command handles makes it more likely that I'll use this feature. (Otherwise, I might avoid it.) 
. This way, I can use the command to do the heavy lifting and make any remaining updates manually.

### Expected behavior

I would like the command output and/or documentation to indicate what changes the command makes.
One possible way to do this might be to add a status or icon to each item in the following guides indicating whether it is handled by the update command/OpenRewrite recipe.
- https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/wiki/Migration-Guide-3.0
- https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/wiki/Migration-Guide-3.0:-Hibernate-ORM-5-to-6-migration  

### Actual behavior

There's no information about what the update command does.
As a user, my only option is to try it out and review a diff of my code.
